comments.body:
Pylint checks if modules are importable or not. I'm wondering if this is really necessary because:

1. We can detect unimportable pacakges when we run tests.
2. We have to install all packages to suppress pylint errors. This drastically increases time to run lint checks which should be done quick.
Agree that this check seems unnecessary
I'll address this in a follow-up.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +9,13 @@import pandas as pd
import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow.python.keras import layers  # pylint: disable=import-error

import mlflow

comments.body: Seems like [tests are failing](https://travis-ci.org/github/mlflow/mlflow/jobs/671795781#L4273) because runs are not ended after the new tests. Adding the fixture `manual_run` to these tests might fix it.
